author: Deanna Kahler
title: Michigan Author Deanna Kahler Nominated For Seventh Award
text:
Most people could use a little hope and inspiration in their lives—especially when hardship strikes. That’s why author Deanna Kahler set out to write books that deal with overcoming life challenges. Since publishing her first book, "From Pain to Parenthood," in 2013, Kahler has received numerous accolades for her work. This month, she was nominated for her seventh book award, the 2016 Global EBook Awards. Kahler’s nominated book, "Echoes of Paradise," deals with a subject that affects every person—death. According to the World Health Organization, more than 56 million people die in the world each year. These losses leave families and friends in a deep state of grief. Some question their faith; some are filled with regrets. And most wonder exactly what happens after death. "Echoes of Paradise" explores these concerns by taking readers on a journey through grief and spiritual awakening. In the book, main character Celeste finds out her one true love has passed away. She then begins noticing strange coincidences that lead her on a quest for answers.
“To those who have lost the great love of your life—read this story,” says an Amazon reader. “It's message of hope and encouragement in the midst of grief and despair is profound and enlightening.”
Kahler felt compelled to write the book after having a few of her own experiences. She hopes her story will offer comfort and remind people of the unbreakable bonds that connect them to others—no matter where they are.
"Echoes of Paradise" is available in both print and ebook on Amazon.com. For those who are interested in meeting the author, she will participate in the Books & Authors event at lifestyle store Leon & Lulu in Clawson, Mich., on Oct. 25 from 11-5. Signed copies of her books will be available.
About the Author
Deanna Kahler is an accomplished writer who enjoys the opportunity to reach others and make a difference in their lives. Her work has been published across the country in corporate newsletters, consumer magazines and on websites. Deanna currently serves as editor for BellaOnline’s Adoption website. She holds a bachelor's degree in communication arts from Oakland University in Rochester, Mich., where she graduated with departmental honors. In her spare time, she enjoys walking, dancing, visiting parks and spending time with her family. For more information, please visit http://www.deannakahler.com .
About the Global Ebook Awards
The Global Ebook Awards honor and bring attention to the future of book publishing: Ebooks. Now in its sixth year, awards are distributed in 72 specific categories. They are open to all publishers, large and small, so that a winner is the best in its category, not just the best of small or regionally-published ebooks. Most ebooks are also available as printed books as well.
